column1: What can Duplicate management help manage duplicates for:Business accounts
Can you prevent duplicates of same name variations?:Yes

What is the difference between a matching rule and a duplicate rule:A matching rule determines whether the record a user is creating or updating is similar enough to other records to be considered a duplicate
column2: whereas a duplicate rule tells Salesforce what action to take when duplicates are identified.

column1: What objects are covered by the standard matching rules?:Business accounts
What are some possible duplicate rule actions?:Block the record from creation
column2: create the record and show an alert
column3: add the duplicate to a report for a manager.

column1: What do the standard duplicate rules do?:display an alert.
Do you have standard duplicate rules?:if your org was created in spring '15 or later
